column4: i'm having problems installing the proprietary drivers for my nvidia grafix card, would the free alternative be any easier to install or have better odds of working?
use envy instead, it sets it up for you
envy as in the free stuff right? thx, thought that, but there is not a big risk of it messing up my system or what?
nah, it's a program that downloads the right driver and sets up xorg.conf for you. just back up xorg.conf if you're worried
found envy allright, ehm... how du i back up xorg.conf again?
well i know what to do now, i will try it. thx for the help
what card have you got?
nvidia 6600 go
didn't work in 7.10 either or 6.60
did you install envyng or whatever it was called?
yep, did not work either
i have tried manually installing everything, nothing works..
what does lspci|grep VGA say?
well, a bit since i've looked in it i will pastebin it for you if you want
the line I wrote should only be one line
it will filter the other stuff out
lspci then what sry?
01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: nVidia Corporation NV43 [GeForce Go 6600] (rev a2)
okay, then I don't know, guess you'll have to google it
aight, thx anyway
